Coulson and May went to see Deke Shaw about Johnson, and he told that that she had gone dark while she tried to rescue Jemma Simmons from Kasius. Coulson asked for Shaw's assistance but he was reluctant, so Coulson played the radio message, which convinced Shaw.

On level 35, Coulson and May discovered Kree laboratories, which Coulson realized were used by the Kree to artificially breed human babies as part of their harsh population control policy. Coulson was told that this process was used by Kasius hoping to create more Inhumans. May told Coulson that she had found genetic data regarding Johnson in the lab's systems which had been entered the day before, meaning Shaw had lied to them and had actually delivered Johnson to Kasius. Coulson was willing to let May beat Shaw for his betrayal, but they were interrupted by the arrival of two Kree guards. The three of them fought off the guards, but Shaw was wounded in the process. With reinforcements on the way, May instructed Coulson to take Shaw with him while she remained to fight the fearsome Sinara.

Having tended to Shaw's wound, Coulson interrogated him and accused him of wanting to deliver the survivors on Earth to Kasius as well. Shaw replied by telling Coulson the stories of his parents, and explained that the person talking on the radio message was Shaw's father. Coulson was willing to believe Shaw's story, but required a sign of his good faith. He ordered him to hand over the reward he had obtained from Kasius for turning over Johnson. Coulson then had Mackenzie lock Shaw in his room, as he felt that it would be safer to have Shaw out of the picture.[124]

Coulson told Alphonso Mackenzie and Yo-Yo Rodriguez about what he had found on Level 35. He voiced his concerns that Daisy Johnson might be sold at an Inhuman auction. They were then approached by Tess, who informed them that the Kree Watch were gathering teenagers to undergo Terrigenesis. Among those selected was Flint, a young boy who had lost his parents in a Renewal, and Coulson advised Tess to go and talk to Flint to comfort him. As the ceremony proceeded, Flint was enveloped in a husk. However, when it cracked open, Flint was not inside.

Coulson quickly figured out that Flint had been taken to safety by Rodriguez, using her superhuman speed. Coulson, Mackenzie and Tess found them both in the Salvage. Tess left with Flint, planning to hide him in the Trawler. Coulson remained in the Salvage, listening to Rodriguez's story of her own Terrigenesis. However, they were interrupted by Grill, who had overheard everything and pinned them down, planning to deliver both Flint and Rodriguez to Kasius to be sold. Coulson attempted to talk Grill out of it, referring to how they seemed to fulfil the prophecy about S.H.I.E.L.D. agents coming from the past to help humans. Grill dismissed this as nonsense and still intended to turn them over to Kasius.

As the situation grew more intense, Flint's geokinesis manifested and he began hurling rocks at Grill. Eventually, through his powers, he created a massive boulder which he hurled at Grill, killing him. Coulson and the others hid with Grill's body in his office to avoid the Kree Watch. Coulson and Mackenzie eventually left the office, looking for Tess so they could smuggle Flint onto the Trawler. They soon discovered that Tess had already been found and murdered by the Kree Watch.[125]

The Vicar ordered the human population of the Lighthouse to disclose any information they had on the whereabouts of S.H.I.E.L.D. or Flint. Coulson and Alphonso Mackenzie returned to the Salvage and attempted to keep the news of Tess' death from Flint, but were soon forced to tell him. The group was then rejoined by Daisy Johnson and Jemma Simmons, who had escaped from Kasius, along with Deke Shaw and, Leo Fitz, who had found a way to join his friends in the future.

Noticing that Flint had disappeared, Coulson went to look for him with Mackenzie and Johnson, and learned Flint had been captured by Sinara, after murdering the Vicar. Coulson shot at Sinara multiple times then was attacked by Maston-Dar, another fearsome Kree warrior. With Mackenzie's help, Coulson escaped from Maston-Dar, while Johnson rescued Flint. All of them then retreated back to the Salvage, where they discussed the possibility of reaching the surface of the Earth with the Trawler.

Since Sinara and Maston-Dar were still in pursuit, Coulson and his team returned to the Salvage and blocked the door. Flint used his powers to reinforce the barricade with boulders, but Maston-Dar used a weapon to blow holes in the walls. Shaw was able to use his Gravity Puck to move everyone to the Trawler's landing bay. When they all reached the ship, Coulson realized that Shaw could not fly it. He asked Flint whether he could, but Flint opted to remain in the Lighthouse to protect the humans. Mackenzie and Yo-Yo Rodriguez volunteered to stay behind and help him. Coulson agreed.

Coulson and the rest of the team boarded the Trawler. With no one else to fly the spacecraft, Coulson opted to pilot it himself, joking that it shouldn't be much different than driving L.O.L.A. In reality, flying the Trawler was harder than Coulson anticipated, although he managed to maneuver the spaceship above the Earth.[126]

Coulson could not prevent the Trawler from crashing to Earth, although no one was hurt in the brutal landing. The team was rescued by a group of True Believers led by Samuel Voss, who took them to their base located on the wreckage of Zephyr One. There, Coulson and the others were reunited with Melinda May, who told Coulson that more mysteries had surfaced. Earlier, May had been welcomed by an elderly Robin Hinton, an Inhuman the agents had known as a little girl in their own timeline.

Coulson and May went to talk with Hinton, after Leo Fitz and Jemma Simmons failed to get answers on their own. Coulson asked Hinton what S.H.I.E.L.D. was supposed to do, but she gave cryptic answers. She then spoke Coulson's full name and said he was the only one who could bring all the pieces together, before grabbing his hand and saying this was the day when all ended. Unable get anything more from Hinton, Coulson went to see Daisy Johnson to brief her. He also instructed her to see Fitz and Simmons to remove her Inhuman Control Device.

Coulson and May returned to Hinton, asking her about Alphonso Mackenzie and Yo-Yo Rodriguez, but got no answers. They asked Enoch for help, but the Chronicom admitted that in the past it had taken several days to get answers from Robin. As he and May discussed their plans, Coulson was approached by Hinton, who handed him a new drawing of Zephyr One flying into space.

Coulson and May went to see Voss to review the True Believers' armory, where they found a fragment of the Time Di'Alla, the artefact which had sent them into the future. Although Voss told them that no one had been able to find any other piece of the monolith, Coulson brought the shard to Fitz and Simmons, who inferred that it fit into an Isochronus Cyclotron built by Owen Shaw. To get more information on this new lead, Coulson instructed Johnson to speak with Hinton.

Later, Coulson and May realized that the True Believers were turning on them. Voss planned on preventing them from returning to their own time, as he believed Quake was responsible for the Destruction of Earth. Coulson fought his way to Johnson, who was defending herself against Voss and two True Believers. Coulson helped Johnson defeat Voss, but couldn't stop him from killing Hinton to prevent her form giving S.H.I.E.L.D. any further help. Coulson and the team mourned her death, then May announced that one of Hinton's drawings pointed to the answer: Flint was the key to returning to their own timeline.[14]

Coulson talked with Enoch about using Flint's geokinetic powers to rebuild a Time Di'Alla so that the team could return home. That meant that they had to take Zephyr One into space, despite the gravity storms. The Chronicom instead advised that they take shelter in the caverns and wait for the storms to subside. Still, Coulson had his team ready Zephyr One for space travel, although that proved to be quite challenging due to the damage the plane had sustained.

Coulson then went to see Melinda May and asked her how she felt after Robin Hinton's death, knowing that in the alternate timeline, Melinda May had actually raised Hinton as her own daughter. Coulson assured May that he had no problem believing that May could have been a mother. He also told the team that he would let Deke Shaw decide of Samuel Voss' fate. Later, while reloading his prosthetic hand, Coulson discussed with Daisy Johnson having her Inhuman Control Device removed. Johnson preferred to leave it in place, as she feared that her powers could be the source of the Destruction of Earth.

Coulson then rejoined his team as they prepared the plane for takeoff, noticing that Shaw had returned after choosing to spare Voss' life. The team attempted to fire up the engines, but they malfunctioned, pinning the plane on the ground. Coulson was willing to follow Enoch's idea of going into the caves, until Jemma Simmons came up with the idea of allowing the gravity storm take them to space and then using the new Gravitonium-based thrusters of the plane to fly. Coulson agreed to this plan.

Despite the anchors malfunctioning, and Coulson being mildly injured due to brutal turbulence, Zephyr One was eventually released from the surface of the Earth thanks to the team's efforts and the violence of the gravity storm, enabling May to pilot Zephyr One in space. Coulson then instructed Johnson to make contact with Alphonso Mackenzie in the Lighthouse. Once Mackenzie replied, Coulson informed him of their return and asked him whether Flint was still with him.[127]

Coulson and his team returned to the Lighthouse using Zephyr One's Containment Module. They left the plane to be inspected by the Kree Watch while they entered the building. Coulson made sure Enoch was safe after leaving him behind to prepare the Isochronus Cyclotron, then he instructed Leo Fitz and Jemma Simmons to find Flint and give him the shard of the Time Di'Alla they had brought. Meanwhile, Coulson, Melinda May, Deke Shaw and Daisy Johnson attacked a group of Kree soldiers who were guarding Inhumans, in order to save the Inhumans and get them to the Trawler.

Remaining with Johnson, Coulson was attacked by an Odium-empowered Tye. Coulson shot him repeatedly with his I.C.E.R., but Tye was impervious to its effect and threw Coulson against the wall. Tye was eventually defeated and killed by Johnson, enabling Coulson to reach the Trawler's bay where they were reunited with Tess, who had been resurrected, like Coulson, by Kree blood. Coulson expressed sympathy towards Tess, assuring her that her second chance at life would be worth it.

Leaving the Inhumans with Tess, Coulson was contacted by Enoch. The Chronicom informed him that the Kree had found him and that he only had minutes before the Kree Watch attacked and ruined S.H.I.E.L.D.'s chances to return to their own time. Shaw offered to return to Zephyr One. Coulson warned him that he would be at a heavy disadvantage, but Shaw insisted, saying all the S.H.I.E.L.D. agents had to survive, so Coulson agreed to let him go.

Coulson had Johnson hack into an elevator so they could reach Kasius' suites, where they planned to create the Monolith. Johnson revealed that she wanted to remain in the 2091 Lighthouse, as she feared her powers might be the cause of the Destruction of Earth if she returned. Coulson refused to respect her decision, stating that he needed Johnson to lead S.H.I.E.L.D. one day. Knowing he could not change her mind, Coulson incapacitated her with his I.C.E.R. before taking her to the suites.

In the suites, Coulson and May were reunited with Fitz and Simmons, who had found Flint. Alphonso Mackenzie told Coulson that Yo-Yo Rodriguez had briefly left. Coulson then watched as Flint used his geokinesis to create the Time Di'Alla S.H.I.E.L.D. needed to return to their own time. Coulson called Shaw to inform him the Monolith was ready and he congratulated Shaw for his help. Noticing that Mackenzie was missing after leaving to look for Rodriguez, Coulson agreed to let Simmons go look for them. Taking Johnson in his arms, Coulson then waited for the Time Di'Alla to be activated, sending him back to his own timeline.[128]

Coulson and the team materialized still in the Lighthouse but now back in the present. They watched an automated orientation video of General Rick Stoner, explaining that the Lighthouse was built by S.H.I.E.L.D. as a secret emergency bunker. Coulson refused medical attention himself, saying he wanted to remain with Daisy Johnson, because she would have questions upon waking. Once Johnson awoke, Coulson explained to her that he would never leave her behind because he needs her with him.

They discovered a mysterious signal coming from St. Louis, Missouri, so the team, minus Johnson, went to investigate. After stealing a van, they were reunited with the Zephyr One and arrived at the St. Louis Aerospace Facility, where they were surprised to see Piper also there. Piper filled them in on what had happened after they disappeared, as they inspected the Kree Beacon which was the cause for the beacon. However, it was revealed that Piper had betrayed them, selling them out to General R. Hale, as a group of Sleeper Mechs arrived, led by a masked individual.

Piper held a gun at Coulson, Leo Fitz and Jemma Simmons, stating that Hale guaranteed the S.H.I.E.L.D. team would not be harmed, but at that moment, the mechs began attacking under the orders of the leader. Coulson questioned Piper's decision to turn on them, and she realized she had also been lied to, so she helped them make their escape. However, during the fight, Yo-Yo Rodriguez had her arms cut off, so they quickly retreated back to the Zephyr One, and returned to the Lighthouse.[129]

After the Kree Beacon exploded in the basement, destroying the three Monoliths, it caused a rift to the Fear Dimension to open up, producing physical manifestations of their fears to appear. Leo Fitz believed that if they used the Gravitonium from Deke Shaw's Gravity Puck, they could temporarily close the rift, but someone would have to sacrifice possibly themselves. Coulson said that he would be the one to do it.

Daisy Johnson, Melinda May and Fitz refused to let Coulson do it as he was their leader, but he stated he needed Johnson to lead S.H.I.E.L.D. when he was gone. Johnson told him that there was no S.H.I.E.L.D. anymore, which Coulson disagreed with, claiming that S.H.I.E.L.D. was a symbol that had to continue. As they argued, Coulson suddenly fainted. When he came to, Coulson was examined by Jemma Simmons, and then sent Shaw out of the Lighthouse with a to-do list.

Coulson joined the rest of his team, where Simmons revealed that he had necrotic tissue branching out from the lethal wound Coulson had sustained in his heart and left lung when he was killed by Loki, meaning that he was dying. May figured this was because of the deal Coulson made with the Spirit of Vengeance, and he explained that becoming Ghost Rider undid the GH.325. Johnson was angry at Coulson for keeping this from them and left, so he followed her and assured her that she would be able to lead without him, and they hugged.

May checked on Coulson, asking if him dying was why he had stepped back from pursuing a romantic relationship with her. Coulson said that he didn't want to waste her time, and also explained that he had made peace with dying, however, he fully intended on surviving closing the rift. Fitz gave Coulson the Gravity Containment Device and warned him about encountering fear manifestations, as well as not to get close to the rift when activating the device, as he could get crushed by the gravity field or sucked into the rift.

After telling Fitz to go through with marrying Simmons even if he didn't survive, Coulson entered the basement, where he lost contact with his team immediately. Coulson encountered a fear manifestation of Mike Peterson, who claimed that he was there to help Coulson realize that he was actually still on the operating table from after he was stabbed by Loki, and that everything he had been though was all in his mind. Coulson was hesitant to believe this, but understood that Peterson was representative of his fear of dying.

Peterson continued trying to convince Coulson, expressing how aspects of his life after being resurrected were just reflections of his own self and desires. However, Coulson managed to not be fooled by Peterson, but was then attacked by him, only for the fear manifestation to be shot and destroyed by the real Deathlok. After helping Coulson back up, Deathlok fought off Lash and some Vrellnexians, and Lash, while Coulson activated the Gravity Containment Device and successfully closed the rift.[130]

Following the completion of the mission, Coulson joined Leo Fitz and Deke Shaw in the elevator, as they headed to the wedding for Fitz and Jemma Simmons. As they talked, Coulson mentioned that Fitz was stalling, as the elevator had stopped, so they got out, where the rest of the team was waiting for them in the forrest environment that had been manifested from the Fear Dimension rift. Coulson, who was officiating the ceremony, decided to get it started quickly due to the unlucky nature Fitz and Simmons' relationship has had. Coulson listened as Simmons said her vows, followed by Fitz, and then he declared them husband and wife.[130]

Coulson went to check on Yo-Yo Rodriguez, as well as to inform her that Leo Fitz would make her prosthetic arms when they had the resources. Coulson brought up his prosthetic hand, but when Rodriguez asked what it felt like, he noted that he couldn't feel at all with it. Fitz informed Coulson that they needed more Gravitonium to close the rift.

Daisy Johnson revealed that Cybertek were last known to be in possession of Gravitonium, but it had mysteriously vanished. Johnson told the team about a group of scientists that worked for Ian Quinn, including Joseph Getty, who all were reported dead, and their death certificates were all signed by Murray Jacobson. Suspecting this to be a cover up, they went to find Jacobson, who turned out to be Alphonso Mackenzie's old friend, Tony Caine. Caine was able to get them in contact with Getty, who told them about the Principia, a ship that was carrying Gravitonium but went missing.

They eventually discovered that the ship was floating in the sky, and once they located it, Coulson, Mackenzie and Johnson boarded it and searched for the Gravitonium. When they finally came across it, Mackenzie contained the Gravitonium in a toolbox, and they went to make their escape before the ship dropped out of the sky. Before they could get out, they were stopped by Sleeper Mechs, so Mackenzie fought them off while Coulson and Johnson returned to the Containment Module. Mackenzie soon joined them and they returned to the Zephyr One. With the mission being a success, the team returned to the Lighthouse, where Coulson handed Fitz the Gravitonium and they discussed R. Hale's involvement.[131]

Coulson, Melinda May and Piper set off in the Zephyr One to capture R. Hale, which they succeeded in by apprehended her while driving. Hale was brought to the interrogation room, where Coulson questioned her as to why she had started a war with S.H.I.E.L.D.

Hale explained that she had been ordered to stop S.H.I.E.L.D. by any means possible, causing Coulson to bring up Yo-Yo Rodriguez getting her arms sliced off, to which Hale countered with Glenn Talbot being shot by Daisy Johnson, but Coulson reiterated that it was an LMD that shot him. The two proceeded to debate their differences as leaders until Hale revealed that she was aware of their plan to capture her, and a Quinjet then arrived with Anton Ivanov on board.

Coulson reunited with Ivanov, and the two discussed their humanity before Ivanov ordered Hale to freed or Carl Creel would detonate the bombs on him, killing them all. Coulson set Hale free, and was asked by the General to come with them so he could understand her plans. May shut down the offer, but Coulson was open to it if it meant all of his agents would be spared, which made May angry with this, so she spoke with Coulson, who explained that it would allow him to gain insight her Hale's plan and how to stop it.

May was still unhappy with Coulson's decision, causing them to argue, but he still went with Hale, departing the Zephyr in the Quinjet. During the flight, Coulson tried to convince Creel that Hale was manipulating him, before giving over his prosthetic hand. Coulson then spoke with Ivanov, figuring out that he was unable to make other copies of himself, and that Hale was in control of him, as she possessed his human head.[132]

Coulson was brought to HYDRA Preparatory Academy, where R. Hale revealed that she was Hydra, and explained that once she told her story to him, he'd agree that it was time for S.H.I.E.L.D. and Hydra to unite.

The next day, Coulson explored the facility, where he encountered Ruby Hale, who ignored him. Coulson was aware that this was a tactic set up by Hale, so he returned to his room and ate cereal. Hale came to Coulson, and revealed that Ruby was her daughter and that she was the one that cut off Yo-Yo Rodriguez's arms. Hale then decided to show Coulson what her plans were, and brought him to the Phase Harmonic Teleportation Device, which Coulson was immediately stated was a bad idea for them to use it.

However, Coulson was forced to comply, so he and Hale used the device and were teleported to meet Qovas, who was a part of the Confederacy. Hale told Qovas that Coulson could help their mission, which Qovas informed Coulson was to protect the Earth from an incoming war. Coulson asked Hale what the Confederacy wanted in exchange, which was Gravitonium and Inhumans. This made Coulson suspicious of the deal Hale had made, but she revealed that she planned on altering the deal, assuming S.H.I.E.L.D. works with Hydra.

The two discussed going against the Confederacy, in which Hale brought up Daniel Whitehall's Particle Infusion Chamber, a machine that could make someone better, and noted that she wanted to use it on Ruby, but she was not suited for it. Hale then proposed putting Daisy Johnson in the machine and infusing her with Gravitonium. When Hale mentioned the name "Destroyer of Worlds," Coulson instantly turned against the idea, knowing it leads to Earth's destruction, but Hale did not believe him.

Coulson's refusal to cooperate had him be taken back to his room, where he was visited by Ruby, who asked about him traveling to the future. She asked how she failed, believing that she was the Destroyer of Worlds, but Coulson told her that it wasn't her, but Johnson. Ruby wanted to know where Johnson was so she could fight her, but Coulson refused, so Ruby brought Glenn Talbot to them. Coulson saw that Talbot had been broken, and that he had told Hydra everything before being dragged away.[133]

Because of Coulson's refusal to cooperate, R. Hale confiscated his access to all of his basic needs. Coulson was eventually visited by Carl Creel, who had been affected by the Gravitonium, saying that it hated Coulson, who tried to convince Creel that he was on the wrong side. When Coulson mentioned that Hale had Glenn Talbot as a prisoner, Creel had Coulson come with him to see if he was telling the truth.

Coulson and Creel found Talbot in his cell, and once Creel was convinced Coulson was telling the truth, they decided to get Talbot out of facility. Creel led them through the facility, but they were soon discovered escaping. Creel fought off the Sleeper Mechs, and when Coulson joined the fight, one of the Mechs punched him in the chest, which caused his heart to stop. Creel revived him by absorbing the electricity from a Mech, but when continued escaping, Ruby Hale found them, so they retreated as more Mechs opened fire upon them.

The three came across the door to the Phase Harmonic Teleportation Device, so Coulson told Creel to open it up for them. But before they could enter, Ruby caught up with them, so Creel decided to stay behind and hold her off as Coulson and Talbot continued to make their escape. Coulson programmed the device to teleport them somewhere on Earth, and they escaped from the facility, landing in the middle of a freezing snow landscape.[134]

As they walked through the snow, Talbot wanted to take a moment to rest, but Coulson insisted that they couldn't stop. Coulson revealed to Talbot that they weren't able to save him sooner because they were in the future. And when Talbot expressed quitting once they were safe due to him being broken by Hale, Coulson tried to comfort him and keep him moving. They were soon found by Ruby, who was about to kill them, but they were saved by Daisy Johnson, who stayed behind as Melinda May and Deke Shaw brought them to Zephyr One.[135]

Deke Shaw had been shot, and needed medical attention, so when they returned to the Lighthouse to treat him, Coulson learned that Leo Fitz was put in a cell, and then freed by Jemma Simmons and Yo-Yo Rodriguez before leaving.

While Coulson watched Shaw being operated on, he told Talbot more about the future that they were sent to, revealing that Daisy Johnson was the one that destroyed the world. Talbot was unsure about sending Johnson on missions if that was the case, but Coulson stated that he wanted her to lead once he was gone, and that Robin Hinton had seen a future where they succeed, so they were working towards that. Melinda May asked if there was anything they could do to help Shaw, so Coulson said they were there if they did.

May then wanted to speak with Coulson alone, which he thought was about Fitz, Simmons and Rodriguez thinking they couldn't be killed, but May stopped him, wanting to talk about the decision he had been making recently that she had problems with. Coulson believed he had made the right choice, but May disagreed with him, including putting Johnson in a leadership position erroneously. Coulson stated that he didn't have much time left and that he had accepted it, but May wanted him to still be careful, revealing that she loved him, which stunned Coulson.[135]

Coulson ran into Melinda May later on and wanted to continue their talk, but May dismissed him, stating that she had said what she needed to say. They then gathered as Daisy Johnson revealed the location of R. Hale's base which they were going to storm, but Coulson was sidelined from the mission. When the agents left, Coulson praised Johnson on her leadership.

As Mackenzie worked on the artificial-gravity system for the Zephyr One, Coulson came to check on him, where both of them addressed Deke Shaw being in love with Johnson, and tricked him into leaving lemons for her. They were later contacted by Johnson and May, who updated them about Hale's capture, Carl Creel's infection from the Gravitonium, and Ruby Hale capturing Leo Fitz and Jemma Simmons. Coulson was worried for Johnson facing Ruby, but she ignored him.

When Coulson discovered the monitor to the Hinton's room had been paused, they went to investigate, where they found Polly Hinton unconscious and Robin Hinton missing. Mackenzie figured out it was Glenn Talbot that took her, as he was under Hydra's control. They found Talbot trying to leave with Robin, so Coulson tried to talk him down. Once Robin was taken to safety, Coulson got Talbot to point the gun at him, but Mackenzie shot Talbot with an I.C.E.R.[136]

With the Gravitonium in their possession, Coulson explained the plan to launch it into the sun, which meant the Zephyr One needed to be upgraded for space travel. During the meeting, they also discussed treating Carl Creel, taking the Hintons to Tony Caine. When the team began arguing over Yo-Yo Rodriguez killing Ruby Hale, Coulson stopped them, stating he would be making all the calls.

After speaking with Glenn Talbot, Coulson learned that he had revealed their location right as Qovas' Ship suddenly appeared. A recorded message from Rick Stoner played, informing them that Project Reclamation had been triggered and to chose from a list of options. Coulson selected nuclear attack not knowing there would be an alien invasion option, which locked down the Lighthouse for 15 years. Coulson then informed the agents of the situation, and spoke with Qovas, saying they wouldn't give over the Gravitonium.

Worried that Daisy Johnson hadn't returned yet, Melinda May revealed that she was also following a lead to find a way to save his life. This led to Rodriguez revealing that she met her future self, who told her that they had to let Coulson die. As Rodriguez and May discussed it, Coulson started to realise that Qovas had the Phase Harmonic Teleportation Device, which could allow them to enter the Lighthouse whenever they wanted.

They then began experiencing energy fluctuations throughout the Lighthouse, and Deke Shaw revealed that the Remorath were inside. After learning about them, Coulson ordered an evacuation of everyone and the Gravitonium, as Leo Fitz found a way to bypass the lockdown. However, they soon discovered the override had been destroyed, so they turned their focus to making a stand in the control room.

In preparation for the fight, Alphonso Mackenzie gave Coulson the Shotgun-Axe to use, and they waited as they heard the Remorath trying to break through the doors. The Remorath soon found a way in, and the agents did their best to fight them off, but were barely able to kill any of them. They quickly became surrounded, and Coulson was knocked to the ground. But before they were all killed, Glenn Talbot arrived, having infused himself with the Gravitonium, and crushed the aliens. Talbot then lifted him and Coulson out of the Lighthouse.[137]

Using his new powers Glenn Talbot lifted himself and Coulson up to Qovas' Ship, and they made their way inside, with Talbot assuring Coulson that he would fix this. As they were being escorted by the Remorath, Coulson sensed that they had left Earth's atmosphere, and discussed with Talbot how he could control the Gravitonium.

Meeting with Qovas, Coulson started to negotiate, but when the alien leader dismissed them, Talbot stepped in and stated that the ship was now his. A Remorath went to kill Talbot, but was instead violently crushed by Talbot, who asserted himself again, forcing Qovas to kneel before him. This behavior concerned Coulson, so he checked with Talbot to see if they were on the same page. After talking with Qovas, Coulson learned that R. Hale was on board, so he went to speak with her.

Hale revealed she sold out his team, and expressed remorse for how her actions resulted in Ruby Hale's fate. Coulson told Hale that he could use her help, and informed her that Project Destroyer of Worlds had been fulfilled by Talbot. Coulson brought Hale to Talbot, telling him that she could help deal with the Confederacy. They discussed the Confederacy and decided to meet with them, as they wanted Gravitonium, which was now inside Talbot.

Coulson suggested that he join Talbot when meeting with the Confederacy, but was turned down, and instead put in charge of the ship while he was gone. Coulson and Hale discussed her history with Hydra, and when Talbot returned, he revealed that Earth was being attacked by an alien named Thanos. When Talbot revealed a plan from the House of Kasius to tap into Gravitonium underneath the Earth, Coulson tried to warn him, but Talbot turned on him and forced Coulson to kneel.

Upon learning that S.H.I.E.L.D. had arrived in the ship, Talbot saw this as mutiny and got aggressive with Coulson, who tried to calm him down. Hale then lied and betrayed Coulson to Talbot, who sent the Remorath to deal with the agents. When Quake and Melinda May arrived, Talbot lifted Coulson and threatened to kill him. Hale tried to use the Faustus programming, but Talbot killed her and proceeded to take Coulson, May and Quake as prisoners.[138]

Qovas had Coulson and Melinda May locked in a cell, and when Coulson stated that they would defeat the Remorath leader, he threatened them, revealing the Ionizer Missiles he had locked onto the Lighthouse. Coulson tried to figure a way out of the cell, but May wanted to talk about Glenn Talbot's turn, which Coulson felt responsible for. They reminisced on how things have changed since they first met Talbot, and how people change, which May added sometimes meant they couldn't be saved, but Coulson felt that they still had to try.

Coulson resumed searching for a way out, using his prosthetic hand to x-ray behind the walls, where he found a circuit panel. Coulson went to destroy it, but the door opened, as Deke Shaw had come to rescue them. Shaw told them about what Talbot was doing, and they went to save Daisy Johnson. They made their way through the ship, following Shaw's directions but came across some Remorath. Fortunately they were defeated by Johnson, who had also escaped, and they discussed disabling the missiles before leaving.

While heading towards the bridge, they stopped for a moment, and May told Coulson that he and Johnson would be going back to the Zephyr One and returning to the Lighthouse, while she and Shaw dealt with the missiles. Coulson questioned whether May was giving him an order, and they started arguing. But when they were under fire from the Remorath, Coulson used his Energy Shield to protect them, and kissed May. Johnson defeated the Remorath, and the group split up, with Coulson telling Johnson not to speak about what she had just witnessed.

Coulson and Johnson made it to the Zephyr, but learned that James Davis was under attack from the Remorath, so they went to help him. After defeating all of the Remorath, Johnson noticed that Coulson was bleeding, but he ignored it an ordered Davis to fly the Zephyr back to Earth. As Johnson bandaged Coulson's hand, she brought up him kissing May. They witnessed Qovas' Ship explode, and were called by Jemma Simmons, who was joined by May and Shaw. They discussed Talbot's recent actions, but Coulson suddenly began violently bleeding and collapsed.[139]

Once they returned to the Lighthouse, Coulson was immediately treated by Jemma Simmons.[139] Coulson was lying unconscious aboard Zephyr One in a hospital bed hooked up to various monitors. He was near death. Nearby, members of his team argued about whether to use the last remaining dose of Centipede Serum to save his life, or to combine it with the single vial of Odium they had and somehow use it to defeat Glenn Talbot and prevent him from destroying the Earth.

Yo-Yo Rodriguez visited Coulson after he regained consciousness. She let him know that she was never arguing for him to die; she was just looking at the big picture. Coulson assured her he would have taken her side in the argument. While heading to Chicago to stop Talbot, Simmons gave Coulson the serum, and he reminded her of what happened to John Garrett and the test subjects from Project T.A.H.I.T.I. He warned that bad things can happen when they don't let nature take her course.

Melinda May came into the room and told Coulson they had gone through a lot to get the serum. He replied that he wasn't happy that he had been left out of that decision. May said that she wanted to see Coulson walk out of the room and rejoin the fight, and both addressed how they felt for each other, which Coulson noted made it harder to leave her behind. May took that as reason for him not to die, and insisted that he take the serum. When she left the room, Coulson decided the best thing was to not take the serum.[140]

While flying to Chicago, Coulson rejoined the team after Daisy Johnson had appointed Alphonso Mackenzie, a decision which he fully supported. Everyone assumed Coulson had taken the Centipede Serum, as he told Johnson to suit up, handing over her gauntlets, which he had hidden the serum in. Coulson then asked for Mackenzie's order, which was to save lives.

When the team reached Chicago, Coulson and Johnson went to confront Talbot in the Quinjet piloted by James Davis. Johnson told Coulson she would hit Talbot hard and restrain him so that Coulson could get close and talk him down. Coulson confessed that he had not taken the serum. Coulson assured Johnson that she was able to face Talbot alone, whether it be getting through to him or beating him with her powers. As Johnson left, she told Coulson to take the serum, and he collapsed into a seat.

While Johnson fought against Talbot, Davis flew the Quinjet back to the Zephyr One and discovered that Coulson had stopped breathing. So, Davis quickly dragged Coulson on board the Zephyr, revealing that he hadn't taken the serum. Yo-Yo Rodriguez began performing chest compressions on Coulson, which she did using her speed powers as it was not initially working. Coulson was successfully revived, and the battle was won, with Quake killing Talbot, using the serum he hid in her gauntlets.[140]

Although the battle was won, Leo Fitz died. However, Jemma Simmons expressed her theory that another Leo Fitz was frozen out in space.[140] When Fitz's body was brought back to the Lighthouse, Coulson, still in a weak state, went to see him. He then spoke with Simmons about her theory, telling her to find him.[62]

The team then gathered in the Zephyr One for Coulson's retirement party. However, everyone was looking somber, so Coulson tried to lift everyone's spirits. The team then began reminiscing about their different homes and how they have all changed.

Coulson then gave a speech, recounting how he has spent a lot of time surrounded by heroes, but none of them were as big of heroes as his team. He then said that they have all suffered losses, and the team added that they would never forget those that they have lost, which was why they put up a plague in the Zephyr, honoring Coulson's legacy. Coulson told his team that they didn't have to forget him, but they had to move on. Jemma Simmons disagreed with this, saying that they never move on.

Coulson expressed his disappointment with not getting to say goodbye to Leo Fitz, and told Simmons to pass it on when they find him. Simmons noted that Fitz would be sad that he missed out on the memorial, which Coulson corrected by saying that he wasn't dead yet. Simmons then gave Coulson the Lighthouse postcard so that he could remember that his team always worked the problem, no matter the odds. The two talked about finding Fitz in space, which Coulson had no doubts about, and he and Simmons then hugged.

Deciding to wrap up the party, Coulson gave a final toast, quoting Robert Burns, "Here's to us. Who's like us? Damn few." Yo-Yo Rodriguez went to say her goodbye to Coulson, hugging him and saying thank you for what he was done for her. Coulson to went to his successor, Alphonso Mackenzie, who claimed that he would call Coulson every chance he got for advice as Director of S.H.I.E.L.D., but Coulson assured him that he didn't need it, and that he would be getting rid of his phone. They then hugged.

Lastly, Coulson went to say his goodbye to Daisy Johnson. They talked about how long he had left, which could have been a few days, or maybe even weeks if he was lucky. Coulson told Johnson that he had left a letter for her in her bunk which entailed how proud he was of her. Coulson told Johnson he was proud of her, and she began to cry, so they hugged. As they hugged, Johnson told Coulson she loved him, and he responded that he loved her too. Johnson also thanked Coulson for the spaceship, as he was no longer needing the Zephyr.

Coulson picked up his duffel bag and began to exit the Zephyr. He took one final look at his team, then put on his sunglasses, and stepped out onto the sand, having chosen to spend his retirement in Tahiti with Melinda May, who stood by his side as they admired the "magical" view. May asked what Coulson wanted to do in his retirement, and he responded that he wanted to just do one thing, which they joked was parasailing. As they held hands, they watched the Zephyr fly over them.[140]

Coulson spent his last weeks in Tahiti with Melinda May, talking about their lives and discussing May's idea to recreate S.H.I.E.L.D. Academy in his name. While drinking wine on the beach, Coulson began to feel the pain in his chest once more, and informed May. The pair soon fell asleep on the beach, and Coulson died in his sleep.[141]

Coulson was greatly missed by all his S.H.I.E.L.D. colleagues, especially Melinda May and Daisy Johnson. After Coulson's death, May returned to S.H.I.E.L.D. to honor his memory and not let his death paralyze her.[15] Johnson, however, had difficulty moving on after Coulson's death. She chose to help Jemma Simmons in her search for Leo Fitz in deep space, because everything on Earth reminded her of Coulson. It wasn't until a year later that Johnson finally read the letter Coulson had left for her. It brought her to tears, but finally gave her some closure.[142]

Unknown to everyone, when Coulson closed the rift to an alleged Fear Dimension, the Space, Time, and Creation Di'Allas created a copy of him that was sent through time and space hundreds of years ago and to a world inhabited by non-corporeal beings, where an individual known as Pachakutiq took over his body. When this happened, Coulson's memories intermingled with Pachakutiq's in a fashion that caused both sets of memories to be clouded. Pachakutiq mistakenly believed that he had had a family that his lover Izel had murdered. This led him to start a crusade to kill her and wipe out the Shrike, adopting the name Sarge.[143] His evil doppelgänger and Izel were eventually killed by Alphonso Mackenzie, before they could doom Earth.[144]

When the team was forced to travel back to the 20th Century to escape the Chronicom Hunters, Leo Fitz, Jemma Simmons and Enoch created a Chronicom Life-Model Decoy version of Coulson to help them navigate the past. They gave the LMD all of Coulson's memories and the added knowledge of all the events that had occurred since Coulson's death.[144]

Philip J. Coulson was a dedicated company man who believed in the principles of S.H.I.E.L.D. and felt that his work within that organization helped make the world a better, safer place. As an agent, he always remained calm in a crisis, was competent and resourceful, fearless, heroic and exhibited his trademark cool, dry wit. As Director, Coulson inspired the loyalty of his team by being compassionate, humble, encouraging, willing to get his hands dirty and always willing to sacrifice himself for the greater good.

Coulson had an introverted personality, although he was charismatic and functioned well in social settings. He was a man of few words and had few people he called friends. The friends he had were colleagues he had grown close to in the line of duty. He kept most people at arm's length, until he knew them for a while and trusted them. He became close with the members of his team, particularly Daisy Johnson, for whom he had paternal feelings, and Melinda May whom he knew for many years. He and May occasionally thought about becoming romantically involved, but nothing came of it until Coulson's health was failing and he was forced to retire. He then spent his final days with May in Tahiti.

Coulson has also displayed great interpersonal skills, being able to handle Tony Stark and make him join the Avengers Initiative when S.H.I.E.L.D. needed him most, to recruit Skye from being an anti-S.H.I.E.L.D. "hacktivist" and transform her into a loyal field agent, and calm down emotionally unstable Mike Peterson due to the effects of the Extremis in his body.

Coulson could be serious and even threatening when a situation called for it, as seen in the fights against Hydra, Hive, Aida and the Kree. He was harsh to Thomas Nash when he was believed to be the Clairvoyant, even telling the man to go to Hell. He is also practical, calmly facing the difficult truth that he was going insane from Project T.A.H.I.T.I. He will put others' needs before his own, illustrated when he was determined to keep Audrey Nathan from knowing of his existence, as he wanted to allow her to heal from her grief. For the greater good, Coulson will put himself through much suffering, as he put himself back into the Theta Brain-Wave Frequency Machine to dig up necessary information. Coulson was literally ready to give his life for the mission: as such, he bonded with the Spirit of Vengeance, accepting to give up on the effects of the GH.325 which had been keeping him alive since his resurrection so that Aida could be defeated.

Coulson also has a humorous side, often displayed in the form of witty or sarcastic comments, especially when hanging around the few people he fully trusts, such as when he and Melinda May went undercover as a married couple. He can be carefree when off-duty, such as when bonding with the members of his team following a successful mission and Leo Fitz fell for a prank. He is also caring, treating his team as family, and protecting them at all costs. While sometimes he presents bad news gently, he knows when it is necessary to present it bluntly. An example of this is when he told Melinda May that she would need to put him down if he went insane. On the other side, Coulson can be quite giddy on occasion, as when he finally met Captain America after being a fan his whole life. He became nervous, and was quite awkward during the meeting.

However, after the events that caused Coulson to lose his hand, as well as to lose Rosalind Price, he has begun to demonstrate a colder and ruthless side, as shown when he was willing to kidnap Thomas Ward in retaliation for Price's murder at the hands of Grant Ward. Additionally, Coulson chose to kill Ward in cold blood, while Ward was handcuffed and defenseless. However, Coulson later blamed himself for this deed and acknowledged that he had crossed a line he had swore he would never breach.

Coulson dedicated himself to his job and had little time for outside interests. He was a natural leader, but did not enjoy the bureaucratic component of being S.H.I.E.L.D. director. He was more than willing to surrender the title to Jeffrey Mace and return to being a field agent. However, Coulson didn't entirely respect Mace's authority and disobeyed some orders, like continuing to search for Daisy Johnson after Mace pulled him off the mission. When he learned that Mace was not an Inhuman, he was able to use the information to regain his power to call the shots, becoming the shadow director, minus the title and the politics.

Though a good man, Coulson could at times let his ego get in the way of what was right. As when he disobeyed Mace's orders, it was under the guise that he knew better because he spent more time as the Director then he did. However, Coulson later learn that his actions in going behind Mace's back led to him being blackmailed by Ellen Nadeer and felt he couldn't go to Coulson due to not trusting him because of all times he went behind his back. He also ignored Glenn Talbot's advicement not to use Johnson's signing of the Sokovia Accords as an opp to bug Nadeer's office, the latter feeling it could be reckless, only for it to produce the very outcome that Talbot was afraid of.

Coulson devoted his entire life to his job and it left little time for outside interests or relationships. Perhaps that was why his greatest regret, which was reversed when he was imprisoned in the Framework, was joining S.H.I.E.L.D. In that virtual world, Coulson followed in his father’s footsteps, becoming a high school history teacher. He got the normal life he sometimes wished he had chosen, but with Hydra in power, that life was far from fulfilling. He was divorced and living alone, teaching Hydra propaganda and standing by while his students were arrested.

In the real world, Coulson never found the time to marry or raise children, but he grew close to his team and they became his surrogate family. Coulson was a warm, compassionate father figure to the younger members of his team, particularly Johnson. He was always concerned for their welfare, dispensing wisdom and hugs, scolding them when they needed it and dishing out dad-jokes. Over the numerous times when Johnson was willing to give up on her life in S.H.I.E.L.D., be it when she left S.H.I.E.L.D. after the death of Lincoln Campbell or when Johnson intended to remain in year 2091 to prevent the destruction of the Earth, Coulson never gave up on her, as he deeply cared for her and even considered Johnson as his most promising successor into S.H.I.E.L.D.'s directorship. When Jemma Simmons was infected with the alien virus, Felix Blake ordered Coulson to sacrifice her to save the rest of his team, but Coulson disobeyed the direct order. After Simmons jumped off the Bus to avoid infecting the others, Coulson scolded her for what she had put him through. Inside the Framework, even with only fragments of his memory, Coulson put himself in front of Simmons during a firefight and then defended her against Mace who was angry she had prevented Grant Ward from killing Leo Fitz. Before attempting to close the dimensional rift in the basement of the Lighthouse and possibly being killed, Coulson made Leo Fitz promise to go through with his marriage proposal to Simmons, whether he survived the basement or not. They shared a warm moment which Fitz could never have had with his own father. When Simmons and Fitz later got married, Coulson officiated the ceremony.

Coulson describes himself as realist, not believing Robbie Reyes made a "deal with the Devil." However, he was forced to reevaluate his perspective during his encounter with Ghost Rider; when asked what Robbie was, Coulson admitted that the flaming skull thing was "a compelling argument for 'hail Satan.'"

By his own admission, Coulson is not afraid of death. When stabbed through the heart by Loki he sarcastically mocked the God of Mischief and even had the strength to attack him. He even encourages Fury to use his death as motivation for the Avengers with his final words. Since being resurrected, Coulson has shown less interest in anything that might prolong his life, especially anything Kree related as can be shown by how he does not attempt to use the methods that brought Tess back from the dead in the Lighthouse especially because the experience of being revived GH.325 was so terrible Coulson begged to be put down as it was being performed on him. However, the Fear Dimension reveals that Coulson harbors some fear of his own mortality such as that all of his experiences will amount to nothing, his legacy will never be remembered and the relationships he made that are closer than family amount to nothing. In his words, though Coulson has accepted his death he is willing to fight against it for the greater good. However, when it came to choosing between saving himself with the Centipede serum or using it to stop Talbot from destroying the Earth, Coulson chose the latter, which turned out o be the correct decision.
